alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 4:19PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Kimball and central Banner Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 319 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Harrisburg, or 13 miles north of Kimball, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harrisburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
